--- title: "Decision Trees - Shipwreak Data" date: "2023-01-09" categories: [Decision Tree, Python] toc: true draft: true --- This is .... [picture] # Introduction https://www.kaggle.com/code/dmilla/introduction-to-decision-trees-titanic-dataset/notebook ## Load Packages ::: {.cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import numpy as np import pandas as pd import regex import xgboost as xgb import seaborn as sns from IPython import get_ipython get_ipython().run_line_magic('matplotlib', 'inline') ``` ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} import plotly.offline as py py.init_notebook_mode(connected=True) import plotly.graph_objs as go import plotly.tools as tls ``` ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} from sklearn import tree from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score from sklearn.model_selection import KFold from sklearn.model_selection import cross_val_score from IPython.display import Image as PImage from subprocess import check_call from PIL import Image, ImageDraw, ImageFont ``` ::: ## Data ::: {.cell execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code} import numpy as np import pandas as pd from pandas import Series, DataFrame ``` ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} titanic = pd.read_csv("../../00_data/titanic_data.csv") titanic.head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=5} ```{=html}
PassengerId Survived Pclass Name Sex Age SibSp Parch Ticket Fare Cabin Embarked
0 1 0 3 Braund, Mr. Owen Harris male 22.0 1 0 A/5 21171 7.2500 NaN S
1 2 1 1 Cumings, Mrs. John Bradley (Florence Briggs Th... female 38.0 1 0 PC 17599 71.2833 C85 C
2 3 1 3 Heikkinen, Miss. Laina female 26.0 0 0 STON/O2. 3101282 7.9250 NaN S
3 4 1 1 Futrelle, Mrs. Jacques Heath (Lily May Peel) female 35.0 1 0 113803 53.1000 C123 S
4 5 0 3 Allen, Mr. William Henry male 35.0 0 0 373450 8.0500 NaN S
``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=6} ``` {.python .cell-code} titanic.head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=6} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: # Splitting Data into Training and Test Data ::: {.cell execution_count=7} ``` {.python .cell-code} import pandas as pd from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split ``` ::: ## split data ::: {.cell execution_count=8} ``` {.python .cell-code} y=titanic.Survived x=titanic.drop('Survived', axis=1) ``` ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=9} ``` {.python .cell-code} x_train,x_test,y_train,y_test=train_test_split(x,y,test_size=0.2) x_train.head ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=9} ``` ``` ::: :::
